item.title: Amanda add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "The only dream worth having is to dream that you will live while you are alive, and die only when you are dead. To love, to be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and vulgar disparity of the life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Nature is a temple in which living columns sometimes emit confused words. Man approaches it through forests of symbols, which observe him with familiar glances." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He was still too young to know that the heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good, and that thanks to this artifice we manage to endure the burden of the past." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "All water has a perfect memory and is forever trying to get back to where it was." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description:
"Once upon a time there lived in Berlin, Germany, a man called Albinus. He was rich, respectable, happy; one day he abandoned his wife for the sake of a youthful mistress; he loved; was not loved; and his life ended in disaster.
This is the whole of the story and we might have left it at that had there not been profit and pleasure in the telling; and although there is plenty of space on a gravestone to contain, bound in moss, the abridged version of a man's life, detail is always welcome." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "This is what you do. You make a future for yourself out of the raw material at hand." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "In the haunted house of life, art is the only stair that doesn't creak." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "He was becoming unstuck, he was sure of that - his bones were no longer wrapped in flesh but in clouds of dust, in hummingbirds, dragonflies, and luminous moths - but so perfect was his equilibrium that he felt no fear. He was vast, he was many, he was dynamic, he was eternal." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Deepak Chopra
item.description: "If you’re really spiritual, then you should be totally independent of the good and the bad opinions of the world…you should have faith in yourself." -- Deepak Chopra

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "like two r's trapped in a spanish songbook, tilli and max lurked in their shoebox castle, waiting to be rolled." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Often, moreover, it is...that aspect of our being that society finds eccentric, ridiculous, or disagreeable, that holds our sweet waters, our secret well of happiness, the key to our equanimity in malevolent climes." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The Middle Ages hangs over history's belt like a beer belly. It is too late now for aerobic dancing or cottage cheese lunches to reduce the Middle Ages. History will have to wear size 48 shorts forever." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The bounties of space, of infinite outwardness, were three: empty heroics, low comedy, and pointless death." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Freedom is often the first casualty of war." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It was a meditation on life, love, old age, death: ideas that had often fluttered around her head like nocturnal birds but dissolved into a trickle of feathers when she tried to catch hold of them." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Commonsense has trampled down many a gentle genius whose eyes had delighted in a too early moonbeam of some too early truth; commonsense has back-kicked dirt at the loveliest of queer paintings because a blue tree seemed madness to its well-meaning hoof; commonsense has prompted ugly but strong nations to crush their fair but frail neighbors the moment a gap in history offered a chance that it would have been ridiculous not to exploit." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "and both of them remained floating in an empty universe where the only everyday & eternal reality was love..." -- Gabriel García Márquez
